timeline.author: fwolter

replies.bodyText: Now we have a redundant logging as the message in updateStatus() is also logged by the framework. You could remove your logging entirely.
replies.author: fwolter

replies.bodyText:
It requires to enable an additional DEBUG log for a particular core bundle ?
My intentition was to get in an easy way feedback from users encountering problems; just by providing logs from the binding.
I even don't know myself what core bundle to enable log (without searching in the code), so imagine a standard user.
But the error will be available in MainUI, so we should request status from MainUI in case a user has a problem.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: This logging is enabled by default via this  setting. It's org.openhab.event.ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent and logged to events.log.
replies.author: fwolter
